title: Cameron Diaz looks effortlessly stylish in a cream jumper as she goes furniture shopping
text:
She's maintained a relatively private personal life ever since she retired from acting following a successful 26-year career in 2016.

And Cameron Diaz made a rare appearance on Tuesday afternoon as she enjoyed a spot of furniture shopping for her $2.178 million Studio City mansion at West Elm in Los Angeles.

The former actress, 47, nailed casual chic during her low-key outing as she sported a cable-knit cream jumper, tied in with a pair of lightly-distressed denim jeans.

Casual: Cameron Diaz made a rare appearance on Tuesday afternoon as she enjoyed a spot of furniture shopping for her $2.178 million Studio City mansion at West Elm in Los Angeles

Opting for comfort in the footwear department, the My Best Friend's Wedding star strolled along the streets of the Californian city in casual loafers.

The Charlie's Angels actress shielded her eyes from the sun in a pair of tinted square-framed shades, teamed with gold accessories.

Displaying her naturally radiant complexion, the blonde beauty went make-up free and wore her shoulder-length tresses in a loosely straight fashion.

Radiant: The former actress, 47, nailed casual chic during her low-key outing as she sported a cable-knit cream jumper, tied in with a pair of lightly-distressed denim jeans

Cameron recently opened up about their marriage in a rare interview, calling husband Benji Madden, 40, 'the greatest human being'.

The media personality told InStyle magazine: 'I just want to build better, stronger friendships with the people who are in it with me. Of course, that includes my husband.

'Getting married to him was the best thing that ever happened to me. My husband's the best. He's the greatest human being, and he's my great partner. Marriage is certainly hard, and it's a lot of work. You need somebody who's willing to do the work with you, because there's no 60-40 in marriage. It's 50-50 period. All the time.'

Smitten: Cameron recently opened up about their marriage in a rare interview, calling husband Benji Madden, 40, 'the greatest human being' (pictured in August 2018)

The couple tied the knot in January 2015 following an eight-month romance, four years after splitting from ex-baseball player Alex Rodriguez.

And the Bad Teacher actress admitted she wasn't sure if she was 'ready' for marriage when they got hitched, but always knew Benji was 'special'.

She added: 'I don't know if I was ready [when I got married], but I knew Benji was special. He's just a good man. There's no bulls***. It's really refreshing. I'm grateful for him.'
description: The former actress, 47, made a rare appearance on Tuesday afternoon as she enjoyed a spot of furniture shopping for her $2.178 million Studio City mansion at West Elm in Los Angeles.
